item.title: Diving deep into Container Networking; An Exploration of Linux Network Namespace
item.description: Introduction # Container networking might seem complex and almost mystical initially, but it’s actually built on basic Linux networking principles. By understanding these fundamentals, we can troubleshoot the container networking layers on a profound level. Furthermore, we might even create container networking solution from scratch for pure enjoyment. Requirements # Linux host Dive Into The Foundations of Container Networking # A container is essentially, an isolated and restricted Linux process within its own networking context that is completely separate from both the host system and other containers.
